title: 2000–01 Macedonian Football Cup
text:
The 2000–01 <a href="Macedonian%20Football%20Cup">Macedonian Football Cup</a> was the 9th season of <a href="North%20Macedonia">Macedonia</a>'s <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> knockout competition. <a href="FK%20Sloga%20Jugomagnat">FK Sloga Jugomagnat</a> were the defending champions, having won their second title the year before after reaching their fifth Final in a row. The 2000–01 champions were <a href="FK%20Pelister">FK Pelister</a> who beat the defending champions to claim their first title after twice been runners-up in the first 2 Macedonian Cups in 1992–93 & 1993–94.
First round.
Matches were played on 13 August 2000.
Second round.
The first legs were played on 8 November and second were played on 29 November 2000.
Quarter-finals.
The first legs were played on 25 February and second were played on 4 April 2001.
Semi-finals.
Summary.
The first legs were played on 17 April 2001. The second legs are scheduled on 3 May 2001, but were postponed to 9 May 2001, due to situation at the border with <a href="Federal%20Republic%20of%20Yugoslavia">FR Yugoslavia</a>.
Matches.
"Sloga Jugomagnat won 6–0 on aggregate."
"Pelister won 4–3 on aggregate."
